citations.narrative:
Possumwood Acres Wildlife Sanctuary is conducting regulated activity with no valid USDA license.
--Signs are posted at this unlicensed facility indicating that public tours for large groups and small private groups are
available. A log of tours conducted to date in 2024 was available during this inspection.
--The facility representative stated that school groups and small private tours occur and patrons are permitted to view and
touch several species of animals at the facility.
--Photographic evidence of covered species being used as education animals with public contact at the facility location
and at offsite public locations is posted on the facility’s social media page.
The facility representative has been made aware of the federal Animal Welfare Act regulations regarding exhibition of
USDA-covered animals without a license during at least two discussions with this inspector at the annual Wildlife
Rehabilitators of NC annual meetings in January 2023 and January 2024. The facility representative has submitted a
prelicense application but is actively conducting regulated activity without holding a valid license.
Exhibiting animals and allowing public contact with animals without the required federal license and oversight can put the
animals at risk of mishandling or disease and the public at risk of injury. The regulations state that no person shall operate
as an exhibitor without a valid license.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
NO regulated activity may be conducted until a valid USDA license is obtained.
Additional inspection personnel: 4 North Carolina Wildlife Commission representatives present for the inspection and exit
interview.
